image.altText: A caucasian man with olive skin and black hair walks through dense greenery with a subtle smile towards the camera

props.synopsis: Organic certification is not legally required for a product to be described as organic, but a business making organic claims must be able to prove them. Some producers say a national standard would give consumers full transparency.

title.children: Calls continue to change organic labelling rules in Australia

image.altText: Sam Welsford celebrates

props.synopsis: Sam Welsford claimed the first ochre jersey of the Tour Down Under on a gorgeous first stage through the Adelaide Hills, as his future prospects continued to improve.

title.children: Prospect enhanced for Welsford in stage one win

image.altText: Bare branches covering a large beige building in the background

props.synopsis: Nathan Aaron Wieland met his teenage victims via social media before arranging to meet them in person. He told one of them to keep their encounters a secret, because the offending could "land me in jail", a court has heard.

title.children: Basketball referee who abused seven teenage boys jailed for 17 years

image.altText: An aerial view showing land with trees and the ocean.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has approved a plan for a $330 million desalination plant to address projected water shortages by 2026, but not everyone is happy.

title.children: Water is set to run out in this region. Why do some reject a proposed fix?

image.altText: Discoloured tomatoes with spots

props.synopsis: Authorities work to eradicate the tomato brown rugose fruit virus, which has already had devastating impacts on South Australian growers.

title.children: Tomato brown rugose fruit virus detected in Victoria for first time

image.altText: Premier Peter Malinauskas walks alongside three people on a congested street

props.synopsis: The South Australian government wants to increase the size of parking spaces in garages for new residential builds, but the opposition and industry groups say it will just make properties more expensive for buyers.

title.children: Larger garages planned in bid to curb on-street parking congestion in SA

image.altText: A man with grey hair and grey moustache wearing a dark polo top

props.synopsis: The brother of murder victim Joanne Lillecrapp says her killer Nicole Therese Courcier McGuinness is a "monster" who should not be granted a fourth chance of parole. McGuinness murdered Ms Lillecrap in 2001 and buried her remains in a strawberry patch.

title.children: Brother of murder victim tells court 'monster' does not deserve parole

image.altText: Elderly lady and man with a beard, sitting at bench with a cup of tea and ipad, looking at camera

props.synopsis: Ageing boomers, a nursing shortage, and a federal capital works system labelled as a "lottery" are forcing some older residents to separate from their families, some regional aged care providers say.

title.children: Aged care residents forced to find a bed hundreds of kilometres away from home

image.altText: A close up of Anthony Albanese in a suit.

props.synopsis: A snap national cabinet meeting was held on Tuesday evening after an attack on a childcare centre in Sydney.

title.children: AFP probing whether anti-Semitic attacks were funded from overseas

image.altText: Hamas militants

props.synopsis: For all of the talk by Israel that it had decimated Hamas, the group's militants have been front and centre since the ceasefire began. It may be down, but it's certainly not defeated.

title.children: Hamas has made one thing clear this week: It's still the boss in Gaza

image.altText: Novak Djokovic roars in celebration after his win

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic's lead-up to his quarterfinal against Carlos Alcaraz was one that would have derailed the tournament for many players. Once again, the Serb showed why he's a cut above the rest.

title.children: Alcaraz, Nine, injuries: Djokovic shows no one thrives more in chaos

image.altText: A large building with multiple windows is ablaze with a giant orange flame behind it.

props.synopsis: Guests were forced to jump out the window of the 11-storey building to escape the fire.

title.children: Fire at Turkish ski resort kills 76 people

image.altText: Alexander Zverev holding a feather to the tennis umpire who is not pictured

props.synopsis: A falling feather leads to a fuming German, a teenager makes an instant impact, and it is double delight for Aussie doubles. Here are the five quick hits from day 10 of the Australian Open.

title.children: Quick hits: Zverev's deja vu, Aussie teen shines and de Minaur up tonight

image.altText: Two children raise their hands in a classroom

props.synopsis: Public school fees have steadily increased over time, with the Parliamentary Budget Office now estimating a cost of about $500 a year per child, but the Greens are pushing to abolish the expense altogether.

title.children: Greens propose abolishing fees for public schools across Australia

image.altText: Three men sat next to each other in uniforms.

props.synopsis: Herzi Halev says he is following through on a promise to quit in the wake of the attacks on Israel, when almost 1,200 people were killed and 250 Israelis taken hostage.

title.children: IDF chief of staff Lieutenant-General Herzi Halev resigns

image.altText: A graphic of President Xi Jinping and President Trump in front of picture of the Chinese and US national currency.

props.synopsis: A decade ago the Chinese government announced plans to transform the country from "a low-cost manufacturing base into a high-tech superpower". Did it work?

title.children: Trump found Xi's 'Made in China' plan 'insulting' but it worked anyway

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The Aussie share market has opened higher off the back of six-week highs on Wall Street after Donald Trump did not introduce blanket tariffs as expected. Follow live.

title.children: ASX higher, Trump announces $500b AI fund, Netflix subscribers rise

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Trump vows to impose tariffs on EU

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka screams out during her Australian Open quarterfinal.

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka had her back to the wall early in the third set of her quarterfinal against Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova, but the world number one stuck to a simple process to stay alive at the Australian Open.

title.children: Sabalenka put herself 'back together' after staring at shock Aus Open exit

image.altText: Prince Harry in a navy blue suit with a silver tie.

props.synopsis: The trial is expected to last 10 weeks.

title.children: Sequel to Prince Harry's lawsuit against British tabloids begins trial

image.altText: A man with black hair combed back sits in a suit with a red tie behind a microphone looking past the camera

props.synopsis: Yoon Suk Yeol has faced South Korea's constitutional court for the first time, following last month's martial law saga.

title.children: South Korea's impeached president faces court over martial law saga

image.altText: A group of rescuers in protective gear carry a body down a foggy road using a makeshift pole

props.synopsis: Rescuers are continuing to search for those missing in the disaster.

title.children: Seventeen dead and eight missing after landslides, flooding in Indonesia

image.altText: Donald Trump hold his hand up.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is back and down to business. Political scientist Geoff Kabaservice from the centre-right think-tank the Niskanen Centre delves into Mr Trump's busy day back in the White House.

title.children: ABC News Daily: Donald Trump's first hours as president

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy at the World Economic Forum in Davos, speaking into the mic

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president has said any ceasefire deal with Russia would require 200,000 European peacekeepers to prevent a new attack from Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy says 200,000 peacekeepers necessary for any Ukraine ceasefire

image.altText: A close up of a man lifting the bar weights at the gym.

props.synopsis: In online groups and gyms, users self-experiment and swap information about performance and image-enhancing drugs. While this "broscience" can be dangerous, it can also be used for good, say scientists.

title.children: Researchers study 'broscience' to limit its harm

image.altText: A composite image of close ups of Carrie Underwood, Donald Trump and Elon Musk.

props.synopsis: President Donald Trump has declared that America's golden age "begins right now" as he was sworn back into office on a day that featured frigid weather, tech bros, a flurry of executive orders, and a surprise move by Joe Biden. These were the key takeaways.

title.children: A missing first lady, Musk's salute: Moments from Trump's inauguration

image.altText: Donald Trump standing in the Oval Office. To his left is Arthur Sinodinos and to his right, Arthur's wife Elizabeth.

props.synopsis: A lack of understanding of how trade tariffs work could come back to haunt Donald Trump but Australia's ambassadors who served during his first term warn that may not matter as he looks set to wield tremendous power.

title.children: Trump's misunderstanding of tariffs could be his downfall, former ambassador says

image.altText: Man sits on deck and smiles while sitting down

props.synopsis: Data from the Australian Competition Consumer Commission shows home and strata insurance in north Australia is "much more expensive" compared to the rest of the country.

title.children: 'Where does it stop?': Home insurance premiums continue to rise in NT

image.altText: A black and white etching showing eight men in different forms of 18th century naval uniform standing on a ship's deck

props.synopsis: The discovery that scurvy, a debilitating illness caused by vitamin C deficiency, could be treated with citrus fruit transformed 19th century naval exploration around the world.

title.children: Two million sailors died of scurvy until the discovery of a simple cure

image.altText: woman with dark rimmed glasses who is age 37 looking at her laptop

props.synopsis: When Nicole Sherwin lost her job, she found fiscal inspiration in unique places. She has saved a bunch, but not everyone is convinced she found it at the best source.

title.children: Mum saved $350 a month after losing her job

image.altText: Nurse about to prick person in finger to test for bacteria

props.synopsis: Does your infection require antibiotics? Two tests are being trialled to remove the guesswork for GPs and confirm whether a test is bacterial or viral almost instantly.

title.children: New tests aim to ease diagnosis for GPs and reduce antibiotic use

image.altText: Image of young child.

props.synopsis: The five-year-old sister of the 22-month-old girl killed in a house fire at a family gathering in Hobart over the weekend has also died, police confirm.

title.children: Sister of child killed in 'tragic' house fire in Hobart dies

image.altText: Lake with rocky outcrop in background.

props.synopsis: Authorities warn there is a "significant risk to the public" after 5,000 litres of oil spilt from an old tank into a popular lake on Tasmania's west coast earlier this month.

title.children: 'Significant risk to the public' after oil spill in Tasmanian lake

image.altText: Architects and supporters of the bark petition gathered in Derby, WA for the presentation of the documents.

props.synopsis: New documentary One Mind, One Heart tells the incredible true story behind the Yirrkala bark petitions and follows their repatriation journey back home.

title.children: A daughter's quest to bring her father's monumental bark petition home
